pullRequest.title: Add Accept & Content-Type headers to rest api spec
pullRequest.bodyText:
This documents the preferred Accept and Content-Type headers to be
sent with API calls.
Elasticsearch supports more content types e.g CBOR and smile but none of
our REST clients actively support these so we don't make an active
effort documenting these.
In some cases there response_accepts documents multiple formats e.g for the _cat API's to signal the preferred mimetype is text/plain but still advertise the fact it can return application/json.

afterCommit.message:
Add Accept & Content-Type headers to rest api spec

This documents the preferred Accept and Content Type headers to be
sent with API calls.

In some cases the API returns two formats e.g cat API's in which case
the `headers.accept` documents both in order of preference.

Elasticsearch supports more content types e.g CBOR and smile but none of
our REST clients actively support these so we don't make an active
effort documenting these.

beforeCommit.message:
Add Accept & Content-Type headers to rest api spec

This documents the preferred Accept and Content Type headers to be
sent with API calls.

In some cases the API returns two formats e.g cat API's in which case
the `headers.accept` documents both in order of preference.

Elasticsearch supports more content types e.g CBOR and smile but none of
our REST clients actively support these so we don't make an active
effort documenting these.

nodes.bodyText: Since this technically supports sending application/json too, should we add it after the preferred application/x-ndjson? I can see an argument against not including it as even though the content-type header is application/json, the request body format must be newline delimited JSON
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,6 +5,10 @@
       "description":"Allows to perform multiple index/update/delete operations in a single request."
     },
     "stability":"stable",
+    "headers":{
+      "accept": [ "application/json"],
+      "content_type": ["application/x-ndjson"]

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  "accept": [ "text/plain", "application/json"]
          
          
            
                  "accept": [ "text/plain" ]
          
      
    
    
  

Cat help looks like it only supports text/plain

Since this technically supports sending application/json too, should we add it after the preferred application/x-ndjson? I can see an argument against not including it as even though the content-type header is application/json, the request body format must be newline delimited JSON
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,6 +5,10 @@
       "description":"Allows to execute several search template operations in one request."
     },
     "stability":"stable",
+    "headers":{
+      "accept": [ "application/json"],
+      "content_type": ["application/x-ndjson"]

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        "description": "Documents the headers the API supports, at a minimum this should document the Accept header and Content-Type header if the API supports a body"
          
          
            
                        "description": "Documents the headers the API supports, at a minimum this must document the Accept header. The Content-Type header should be documented if the API supports a body"
Similar to other APIs that expect newline delimited JSON request body - I think we should be consistent on whether we document application/json as accepted Content-Type across these APIs
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,6 +5,10 @@
       "description":"Sends data to an anomaly detection job for analysis."
     },
     "stability":"stable",
+    "headers":{
+      "accept": [ "application/json"],
+      "content_type": ["application/x-ndjson", "application/json"]

nodes.bodyText: guess this change can be discarded?

Since this technically supports sending application/json too, should we add it after the preferred application/x-ndjson? I can see an argument against not including it as even though the content-type header is application/json, the request body format must be newline delimited JSON
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,6 +5,10 @@
       "description":"Allows to execute several search operations in one request."
     },
     "stability":"stable",
+    "headers":{
+      "accept": [ "application/json"],
+      "content_type": ["application/x-ndjson"]

nodes.bodyText: Since this technically supports sending application/json too, should we add it after the preferred application/x-ndjson? I can see an argument against not including it as even though the content-type header is application/json, the request body format must be newline delimited JSON
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,6 +5,10 @@
       "description":"Finds the structure of a text file. The text file must contain data that is suitable to be ingested into Elasticsearch."
     },
     "stability":"experimental",
+    "headers":{
+      "accept": [ "application/json"],
+      "content_type": ["application/x-ndjson"]

commit.message:
Add Accept & Content-Type headers to rest api spec

This documents the preferred Accept and Content Type headers to be
sent with API calls.

In some cases the API returns two formats e.g cat API's in which case
the `headers.accept` documents both in order of preference.

Elasticsearch supports more content types e.g CBOR and smile but none of
our REST clients actively support these so we don't make an active
effort documenting these.

Update rest-api-spec/src/main/resources/rest-api-spec/api/cat.help.json

Co-authored-by: Russ Cam <russ.cam@elastic.co>
(cherry picked from commit a3b7283df310e61ba5a71fa1e3b788dfbec59420)
